page.title: Simple Example Using Redis Keys
page.description: Redis can be used to get/set keys/value pairs.

description.p: Perhaps the simplest use of redist is storing key/value pairs. This feature allows for variables that can be saved and retreived across applications.
The Get method retreives a key value. If a key does not yet exist, a type of 'Nil' will be returned in the RedisResult.

section.example: dim redis as extension::RedisClient = extension::RedisClient::CreateClient() dim key as extension::RedisResult key = redis.Get("MyMessage") ? key.type = "Nil" ? key.valueString = ""

description.p: The Set method is used to set either a string or numeric value to a key.

section.example: redis.Set("MyMessage","Hello world") key = redis.Get("MyMessage") ? key.type = "String" ? key.valueString = "Hello world"

description.p: The Del method is used to remove a key from redis.
